_comment: Master drug registry ‚Äî single source of truth for all drug classes and drugs. To add a new class: (1) add an entry here, (2) create pages/{id}.html, (3) add audio files to assets/audio/{id}/

classes.name: Antipsychotics
classes.description: Drugs used to manage psychosis, schizophrenia, and related disorders.

classes.name: Anesthetics
classes.description: Agents used to induce and maintain general or local anesthesia.

classes.name: Antiarrhythmics
classes.description: Medications that treat irregular heart rhythms and conduction disorders.

classes.name: Anticonvulsants
classes.description: Drugs that prevent or reduce the frequency of seizures.

classes.name: Antidepressants & Mood Stabilizers
classes.description: Drugs for depression, bipolar disorder, and mood regulation.

classes.name: Antiparkinson Drugs
classes.description: Agents used to manage Parkinson's disease symptoms.

classes.name: Glaucoma Drugs
classes.description: Medications used to reduce intraocular pressure in glaucoma.

classes.name: Muscle Relaxants
classes.description: Drugs that reduce muscle tension, spasms, and spasticity.

classes.name: Sedative-Hypnotics
classes.description: Central nervous system depressants used for sedation and sleep.

classes.name: Anxiolytics
classes.description: Drugs used to reduce anxiety and treat anxiety disorders.

classes.name: Stimulants & ADHD Drugs
classes.description: CNS stimulants used for ADHD, narcolepsy, and related conditions.

classes.name: Local Anesthetics
classes.description: Agents that block nerve conduction in a specific region.

classes.name: Antihypertensives
classes.description: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, beta blockers, and calcium channel blockers.

classes.name: Antianginals
classes.description: Drugs used to relieve angina and reduce myocardial oxygen demand.

classes.name: Heart Failure Drugs
classes.description: Agents used to manage systolic and diastolic heart failure.

classes.name: Antilipidemic Agents
classes.description: Statins and other drugs that lower cholesterol and triglycerides.

classes.name: Anticoagulants & Antiplatelets
classes.description: Drugs that prevent blood clot formation and platelet aggregation.

classes.name: Thrombolytics
classes.description: Clot-dissolving agents used in stroke, MI, and pulmonary embolism.

classes.name: Antibiotics
classes.description: Penicillins, cephalosporins, macrolides, fluoroquinolones, and more.

classes.name: Antivirals
classes.description: Drugs used to treat viral infections including HIV, herpes, and influenza.

classes.name: Antifungals
classes.description: Agents used to treat systemic and topical fungal infections.

classes.name: Antiparasitics
classes.description: Drugs used to treat parasitic infections including protozoa and helminths.

classes.name: Antimycobacterials
classes.description: Drugs used to treat tuberculosis and other mycobacterial infections.

classes.name: Diuretics
classes.description: Loop, thiazide, and potassium-sparing diuretics for fluid and BP management.

classes.name: Bronchodilators
classes.description: Beta-2 agonists, anticholinergics, and methylxanthines for asthma and COPD.

classes.name: Respiratory Corticosteroids
classes.description: Inhaled and systemic steroids for airway inflammation.

classes.name: Antihistamines & Allergy Drugs
classes.description: H1 blockers and related agents for allergic rhinitis and urticaria.

classes.name: Acid-Related Drugs
classes.description: PPIs, H2 blockers, and antacids for GERD, peptic ulcer, and H. pylori.

classes.name: Antiemetics
classes.description: Drugs used to prevent and treat nausea and vomiting.

classes.name: Bowel Agents
classes.description: Laxatives, antidiarrheals, and IBD drugs.

classes.name: Hepatic & Biliary Drugs
classes.description: Drugs used in liver disease, hepatitis, and biliary disorders.

classes.name: Diabetes Drugs
classes.description: Insulin, metformin, GLP-1 agonists, and other antidiabetics.

classes.name: Thyroid Drugs
classes.description: Agents used to treat hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism.

classes.name: Corticosteroids
classes.description: Systemic glucocorticoids and mineralocorticoids.

classes.name: Reproductive Hormones & Contraceptives
classes.description: Estrogens, progestins, androgens, and hormonal contraceptives.

classes.name: NSAIDs & Analgesics
classes.description: Non-opioid pain relievers and anti-inflammatory drugs.

classes.name: Opioids
classes.description: Narcotic analgesics for moderate to severe pain.

classes.name: Gout Drugs
classes.description: Agents for acute gout attacks and long-term urate-lowering therapy.

classes.name: DMARDs & Biologics
classes.description: Disease-modifying agents for rheumatoid arthritis and autoimmune conditions.

classes.name: Chemotherapy
classes.description: Cytotoxic agents used to treat malignancies.

classes.name: Targeted Therapy & Biologics
classes.description: Monoclonal antibodies and small-molecule inhibitors for cancer.

classes.name: Immunosuppressants
classes.description: Agents used to suppress immune response in transplant and autoimmune disease.
